alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 12 at 8:49AM PST until January 12 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Risk of nuisance coastal flooding during this morning`s high tide. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Ventura County Beaches, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high tide of 6.6 to 6.9 feet is expected at 900 AM this morning.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches
